prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 1. **Draw the 2D Sketch** Create a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a rectangle using the following line segments: * Line 1: Starting at (0, 0.0274), ending at (0.0274, 0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.0274, 0), ending at (0.7226, 0) * Line 3: Starting at (0.7226, 0), ending at (0.75, 0.0274) * Line 4: Starting at (0.75, 0.0274), ending at (0.75, 0.6113) * Line 5: Starting at (0.75, 0.6113), ending at (0.7226, 0.6387) * Line 6: Starting at (0.7226, 0.6387), ending at (0.0274, 0.6387) * Line 7: Starting at (0.0274, 0.6387), ending at (0, 0.6113) * Line 8: Starting at (0, 0.6113), ending at (0, 0.0274) 2. **Scale the 2D Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 uniformly in all directions. 3. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the 2D sketch into the 3D sketch by moving it along the Z-axis by 0.0091 (extrude_depth_towards_normal). 4. **Extrude the 3D Model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0091 (extrude_depth_towards_normal) to generate the 3D model. Add a flat top by extruding the top line segment of the rectangle along the negative Z-axis one more time by 0.0091 (0.0091 - 0.0091*0.75). The dimensions of this part are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0091</description>
